channel.description: Recent content in Community post on Microsoft 365 Platform Community Blog

item.title: How to contribute to this blog
item.description: Everyone’s voice matters! We want to publish your content on all things you build with code, low-code, no-code on and around Microsoft 365.
Everyone’s voice matters! We want to publish your content on all things you build with code, low-code, no-code on and around Microsoft 365.

item.title: Style your command bar with formatting magic
item.description: A little background story about this article. For a customer, I was working on a ListView Command Set extension.

item.dc:creator: Jasey Waegebaert

item.title: How to rename files in SharePoint with Power Automate
item.description: Although SharePoint and Power Automate are heavily interwoven, there is no “rename file” action in Power Automate - if the file lives in a SharePoint library.
Although SharePoint and Power Automate are heavily interwoven, there is no “rename file” action in Power Automate - if the file lives in a SharePoint library.
item.dc:creator: Luise Freese

item.title: New Microsoft 365 platform community blog
item.description: Hello World Let us introduce our new Microsoft 365 platform community blog to you!

item.title: How to use oh-my-posh with PnPPowerShell
item.description: What is oh my posh? Oh-my-posh is an amazing prompt engine that does not only pretty up the terminal you use, but it will ease your work.

item.title: Community Sample: React FAQs webpart

item.title: How to get started deploying Azure resources using Bicep
item.description: Luise takes you from zero to hero when deploying Azure resources using Bicep instead of traditional ARM templates. Learn about tools, process and additional tips

item.title: Displaying selected SharePoint form fields as read-only using List Formatting
item.description: With the setValue action on SharePoint/Microsoft Lists JSON formatting, people from the community are creating several solutions or use cases, including myself in the two samples: Quick Approvals and Like/Dislike.

item.title: Migrate Cloud Flows and Canvas Apps across tenants
item.description: Introduction If you are a Power App or Power Automate developer, chances are you had to move your creations between SharePoint sites or even Microsoft 365 tenants.
Introduction If you are a Power App or Power Automate developer, chances are you had to move your creations between SharePoint sites or even Microsoft 365 tenants.
item.dc:creator: Denis Molodtsov

item.title: How to create a custom connector for your own Azure hosted API
item.description: In this blog post I am going to cover: How to create an API with JavaScript, How to deploy this to Azure, How to wrap the API into a custom connector, How to use the connector in Power Apps
In this blog post I am going to cover: How to create an API with JavaScript, How to deploy this to Azure, How to wrap the API into a custom connector, How to use the connector in Power Apps
item.dc:creator: Luise Freese

item.title: Showing and hiding content in Adaptive Cards
item.description: In Adaptive Cards there are multiple ways to show and hide content depending on other content or conditions, or even user interaction. But despite that most of them is available since the version 1.2 (so quite early) it requires a bit of knowledge how to actually implement them.

In Adaptive Cards there are multiple ways to show and hide content depending on other content or conditions, or even user interaction. But despite that most of them is available since the version 1.2 (so quite early) it requires a bit of knowledge how to actually implement them.
item.dc:creator: Tomasz Poszytek

item.title: Don't pay more for SharePoint Storage than you have to :-)
item.description: Even though most of us likes Microsoft, on some days more than others, there are no reason why we should pay more than necessary.
Even though most of us likes Microsoft, on some days more than others, there are no reason why we should pay more than necessary.
item.dc:creator: Kasper Bo Larsen

item.title: Create your first Adaptive Card Extensions(ACEs) with SPFx
item.description: In this article, we will learn how to extend your Viva Connections with our known SharePoint Framework(SPFx). We can extend our Viva Connections dashboard with out-of-the-box web parts, custom SPFx web parts, extensions, and now with Adaptive Card Extension, etc.

In this article, we will learn how to extend your Viva Connections with our known SharePoint Framework(SPFx). We can extend our Viva Connections dashboard with out-of-the-box web parts, custom SPFx web parts, extensions, and now with Adaptive Card Extension, etc.
item.dc:creator: Siddharth Vaghasia

item.title: Make a bot for simple interactions in Teams using a Webhook
item.description: Have you ever had an idea to ask a bot to perform a simple interaction? Then this article is for you

item.title: Microsoft 365 self-service using Power Apps

item.title: PnP PowerShell or CLI for Microsoft 365 or both or other
item.description: During my SP consultant/dev work I most of the times used the last two. From time to time I got the question: which one is better?
During my SP consultant/dev work I most of the times used the last two. From time to time I got the question: which one is better?
item.dc:creator: Adam Wójcik

item.title: CLI for Microsoft 365 on your mobile
item.description: CLI for Microsoft 365 is a cross platform command line tool you may use to manage many things. To name a few, you may manage OneDrive, Planner, Power Apps and Automate, Teams, Yammer, SharePoint (of course), now there is even a dedicated command to help you set up Viva. The list keeps on growing and growing

CLI for Microsoft 365 is a cross platform command line tool you may use to manage many things. To name a few, you may manage OneDrive, Planner, Power Apps and Automate, Teams, Yammer, SharePoint (of course), now there is even a dedicated command to help you set up Viva. The list keeps on growing and growing
item.dc:creator: Adam Wójcik

item.title: How to convert HTML content or file to PDF using the Muhimbi API?
item.description: Introduction This article is used whenever you are getting any content from SharePoint List/Library or anything else and rendering it in any component then it is difficult to get HTML from that component and extract CSS as well so here we will create a dynamic HTML (List or Table or anything else as per our requirement) and we can add some inline CSS as well.

Introduction This article is used whenever you are getting any content from SharePoint List/Library or anything else and rendering it in any component then it is difficult to get HTML from that component and extract CSS as well so here we will create a dynamic HTML (List or Table or anything else as per our requirement) and we can add some inline CSS as well.
item.dc:creator: Chandani Prajapati

item.description: Images always enricher Adaptive Cards designs. However in Microsoft Teams max.
